text: I just love how each chapter of this game had its unique setting, story and characters. This one was memorable for many reasons, but I always liked spooky themed levels in video games. That and Viviane was my favorite partner in the game. I would love to have a Paper Mario collection for the Switch with the first 3 games in the series.
author: SupraDarky

text: I missed out on all Paper Marios, so I would definitely purchase a re-release. I also would like to keep the genders of the ghosts as in the Japanese version, as unlikely as that may sound.
author: Hefaestos

text: @Hefaestos This one is the real standout of the series. The first is cute and fun and worth a play, though not as deep; the third one is rough because the mix of RPG and platforming that's very easy, plus lots of back-tracking stretch out the gameplay even though the story was good. If you get a chance to pick up TTYD or even Paper Mario 64 on virtual console, I recommend them.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: This might be a stretch, but I'm hearing a slight Amon Tobin inspiration in this one. Just some recognizable sounds.

text: Twilight Town was a really cool setting. This game was full of them. The backtracking in Chapter 4 got pretty annoying, but the story in it was great.
